question: If ABC is an equilateral triangle and P, Q, R respectively denote the middle points of AB, BC, CA then
option1: PQR must be a right angled triangle
option2: PQR must be an equilateral triangle
answer: PQR must be an equilateral triangle
explanation:
The line segments joining the mid points of the sides of a triangle form four triangles, each of which is similar to the original triangle. 
So PQR must be an equilateral triangle.
